children.child_desc1:
Minute ventilation when not intubated = 60 ml/kg/min. Double to 120 mL/kg/min when intubated due to dead space
Mild hypercarbia is ok.

child_bullets.title: FiO2
child_bullets.subtext: Start at 100% FiO2 and titrate down

child_bullets.title: PEEP
child_bullets.subtext: Start at 5 or higher for severe hypoxemia

child_bullets.title: Titrate
child_bullets.subtext: FiO2 and PEEP based on chart every 5-10 min; quicker if low sat

children.child_desc:

If > 30, reduce Vt by 1mL/kg IBW down to 4mL/kg IBW
Volume control or pressure control
6- 8 mL/kg IBW
Start at 10-14

child_bullets.title: FiO2
child_bullets.subtext: Start at 100% and titrate down quickly

child_bullets.title: Tips
child_bullets.subtext:
Ok to allow for permissive hypercapnia (PaCO2 <90)

Acidemia to pH >~7.1 is ok

Place as large an ETT as possible (aim for 8.0)

child_bullets.subtext: FiO2 and PEEP based on chart every 5-10 min; quicker if low sat

children.child_detail_desc:
10 mg IVPB over 1 hour
Do not give if with concurrent clot OR caution with warfarin resistance

**Typically given w/VitK 10 mg ivpb**

**Typically given w/VitK 10 mg ivpb**
1 unit = 220 mL = 1 gm/dL rise in Hgb

children.special_instruction_header: ** If SBP >= 160 or DBP >= 110, give anti-HTN meds

children.child_detail_desc:
Start: 5 mg IV push over 2 mins
Then: 5-10 mg IV push over 2 mins q20-40min up to 20mg total (if goal SBP or DBP not met, use Labetalol)

Start: 20 mg IV push over 2 mins
Then: 20-80 mg IV push over 2 mins q10-30min
MAX: 300mg/day
Infusion: 1-2 mg/min IV
Avoid in: asthma heart disease, heart block, bradycardia

Immediate release. Usually not first line due to potential for precipitous drop in BP

Start: 10-20mg PO
Then: Repeat in 20min
Then: 10-20mg PO q2-6 hours
MAX: 180mg in 24hr

children.special_instruction_header: (i.e. platelets < 100,000, AKI, serum transaminases doubled, pulm edema, HA, visual distrubances, abd pain)

children.child_detail_desc:
Call OB, anti-HTN as in pre-eclampsia

Give magnesium sulfate:
Load: 4-6mg IV over 20-30 min
Then: 2g/hr Infusion (Therapeutic level range from 4-7 mEq/L)

If with seizure despite above:
- Give another magnesium sulfate 2gm IV bolus

Monitor for magnesium toxicity:
- Loss of patellar reflexes
- Respiratory depression
- Decreased UOP
- Cardiac arrest, bradycardia, heart block

Treatment for magnesium toxicity (severe cardiac toxicity or cardiac arrest):
- Calcium gluconate 10%: 1.5-3gm IV push over 3 mins
